snippet.title: Last minute sale saves Coast gym from closure
snippet.content: MEMBERS of a much-loved Coast gym are celebrating after the centre was brought back from the brink of closure with a last minute sale. Owners of Buderim's MyBody Women's Health and Fitness announced the gym would close early next month via Facebook last week due to their "personal and financial situation". Previous attempts to sell the business were unsuccessful, but now husband and wife duo Kate and James Boileau will take over on August 14 with a seven-day free trial offer. The gym has been popular with older women due to its range of fitness classes and its community spirit. Mrs Boileau said the decision to buy the gym stemmed from how highly she thought of the business. "I've been a member here since February," she said. "The women here have been the most beautiful, supportive, community for me. "When we heard the gym was closing James and I just decided to take a look and it was a great opportunity." The pair have decades of experience between them in the fitness industry with Mr Boileau a qualified remedial massage therapist, personal trainer and group fitness trainer and Mrs Boileau a former Les Mills instructor. "We will be offering the classes that are already existing here, plus putting on some new classes," Mrs Boileau said. "Also, he'll be working as a massage therapist here as well. "We're really excited about it."
